{{Infobox road |country=USA |route=395 |type=I |map=I-395 (CT-MA) map.svg |maint=[[ConnDOT]] |length_mi=66.60 |length_round=2 |length_ref={{cite web|url=http://www.fhwa.dot.gov/reports/routefinder/table2.cfm|title=Route Log and Finder List - Interstate System: Table 2|publisher=[[Federal Highway Administration|FHWA]]|accessdate=2007-10-03}} |established=1968 (as Route 52)
1983 (as I-395) |direction_a=South |terminus_a={{Jct|state=CT|I|95|name1=[[Connecticut Turnpike]]}} in [[East Lyme, Connecticut|East Lyme, CT]] |junction={{Jct|state=CT|Route|2}} in [[Norwich, Connecticut|Norwich, CT]]
{{Jct|state=CT|US|6}}in [[Killingly, Connecticut|Killingly, CT]]
{{Jct|state=CT|US|44}} in [[Putnam, Connecticut|Putnam, CT]] |direction_b=North |terminus_b={{Jct|state=MA|I|90|I|290|Route|12}} in [[Auburn, Massachusetts|Auburn, MA]] }} '''Interstate 395''' (abbreviated '''I-395''') is a 67-mile-long north–south [[Interstate Highway]] that begins at [[Interstate 95 in Connecticut|Interstate 95]] in [[East Lyme, Connecticut]] and ends at [[Interstate 90]] in [[Auburn, Massachusetts]], where it becomes [[Interstate 290 (Massachusetts)|Interstate 290]]. The original designation for the freeway was '''Route 52'''. Route 52 was slated to become an extension of Interstate 290 before it received the I-395 designation in 1983."State Ordered To Lift Ban on Tandem Trucks." ''Hartford Courant'', June 14, 1983. The article lists "I-290 (formerly Route 52)" as one of the highways the lifting of the ban applies to. From its southern terminus to its intersection at Exit 90 in [[Plainfield, Connecticut]] with [[State Road 695 (Connecticut)|State Road 695]], I-395 is also part of the [[Connecticut Turnpike]]. ==Route description== From [[East Lyme, Connecticut|East Lyme]] to [[Plainfield, Connecticut]], I-395 is part of the '''[[Connecticut Turnpike]]''' (the '''Gov. John Davis Lodge Turnpike'''). From Plainfield to [[Thompson, Connecticut]], I-395 is named '''The American Ex-Prisoner of War Memorial Highway'''. {{Expand section|date=May 2008}} ===Service plazas=== In Connecticut, there are three Service Plazas that provide 24-hour gas stations and convenience stores. They do not have restaurants but do have phones and rest rooms. *Montville â MP 8 - Southbound only between exits 79A and 79. *Plainfield â MP 35 - Northbound and Southbound between exits 89 and 90. A State Police station is located on the northbound side of the highway in Montville in what used to be another Service Plaza. {{clear}} ==History== {{Empty section|date=May 2011}} {{clear}} ==Exit list== {|class="wikitable" |- !Location ![[Exit number|#]] !Mile !Destinations !Notes |- |rowspan=2|[[East Lyme, Connecticut|E.
